instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01041 a1990 no power water damage PPBUS_G3H full short
threads.message:
hello got this a1990 PPBUS_G3H is full short 
i tried removed f7000/1 pin 2 PPBUS_G3H is shorted. 
when i injected voltage from ppbus only the cpu is getting hot 
i didnt see any caps overheating. 
btw: PPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS shorted also
tried inject also here but same only cpu is heating.

threads.title: 820-01041 a1990 no power water damage PPBUS_G3H full short
threads.message: this is exactly is over heating when injecting ppbus

threads.title: 820-01041 a1990 no power water damage PPBUS_G3H full short
threads.message:
If CPU was not already dead, you've killed it injecting voltage in such manner!!!
So many threads and discussions about same error on the forum.

You have a shorted chip on the CPU power supply, very likely.
I talk about U7210/20/30, or U7410/20.
"Be aware, some CPU/GPUs have very low value as normal; latest CPUs measure like pure short in fact!"
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
